measurableElement.name: Use of Housekeeping Checklist in Toilets
Availability of closed drainage system
Gradient of Drains is conducive for adequate for maintaining flow
Availability of connection with Municipal Sewage System/ or Soak Pit
All the drains are cleaned once in a week
No blocked/ over-flowing drains in the facility
Corridors are rigorously cleaned with scrubbing / flooding once in a month
No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust on walls and roofs of corridors
Surfaces are conducive of effective cleaning
Corridors are cleaned at least twice in the day with wet mop
No dirt/Grease/Stains in the Circulation area
An existing committee or newly constituted committee for review and monitoring of BMW management at DH/CHC level
The facility has started undertaking actions, which are to be complied by March 2017
The Hospital leadership is aware of Biomedical Waste Rules 2016 including key changes in the rule vis~a~vis Biomedical Waste Rule 1998.
The facility has implemented Biomedical Waste Rules
The facility has started undertaking actions, which are to be complied by March 2018
The Storage facility is located away from the patient area and has connectivity of a motorable road.
The Storage facility is secured against pilferage and reach of animal and rodents.
No Biomedical waste is stored for more than 48 Hours
The storage facility has hand-washing facilities for the workers
Dedicated Storage facility is available for biomedical waste and its has biohazard symbol displayed
The Health Facility has adequate arrangements for disposal of Biomedical waste
Disposal of Expired or discarded medicine is done as per protocol given in Schedule I of BMW Rules 2016
Discarded / contaminated linen is disposed as per procedure given in the BMW Rules 2016
Recyclable waste is disposed as per procedure given in the BMW Rules 2016
Deep Burial Pit is constructed as per norms given in the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
Availability of trolleys for waste collection and transportation
Availability of Bins and liners for segregated collection of waste at point of use
Availability of Sodium Hypochlorite Solution
Availability and supply of personal protective equipment
Availability of Needle/ Hub cutter and puncture proof boxes
Disinfection of Broken / Discarded Glassware is done as per recommended procedure
The Staff uses needle cutters for cutting/burning the syringe hub
Staff is aware of needle stick injury Protocol and PEP is available to the staff
The Facility has treatment facility for managing infectious liquid waste
Runoff is drained into the municipal drain
Body fluids, Secretions in suction apparatus, blood and other exudates in OT, Labour room, minor OT, Dressing room are disposed only after treatment
The laboratory has a functional protocol for managing discarded samples
Sullage is managed scientifically
Disposal of Disinfectant solution like Glutaraldehyde
Availability of Mercury Spill Management Kit
The Staff is aware of Mercury Spill management
Disposal of Radiographic Developer and Fixer
The Facility Undertakes efforts to educate patients and visitors about segregation of recyclable and biodegradable wastes
General Waste is not mixed with infected waste
Availability of Compost Pit within the premises
The facility has introduced innovations in managing General Waste
Recyclable and Biodegradable Wastes have segregated collection
The Health Facility submits Annual report to pollution control board
The Health Facility has a system of review and monitoring of BMW Management through an existing committee or by forming a new committee
The Health facility maintains its website and annual report is uploaded
The Health Facility maintains records, as required under the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
The Health Facility has a valid authorization for Bio Medical waste Management from the prescribed authority
Transportation of biomedical waste is done in closed container/trolley
Work instructions for segregation and handling of Biomedical waste has been displayed prominently
The facility has linkage with a CWTF Operator or has deep burial pit (with prior approval of the prescribed authority)
Biomedical waste bins are covered
Segregation of BMW is done as per BMW management rule,2016
Maintenance of adequate bed to bed distance in wards
Restriction of visitors to Isolation Area
Provision of Isolation ward
Restriction of external foot wear in critical areas
Infectious patients are not mixed for general patients
Regular Monitoring of infection control practices
Regular Medical check- ups of food handlers and housekeeping staff
Infection Control Committee is constituted and functional in the Hospital
Immunization of Service Providers
Antibiotic Policy is implemented at the facility
Hospital measures Device Related HAI rates
Hospital measures Blood Related and Respiratory Tract HAI
Hospital measures Surgical Site Infection Rates
Hospital takes corrective Action on occurrence of HAIs
Regular microbiological surveillance of Critical areas
Correct method of wearing and removing gloves
The Staff is aware of Standard Precautions
No re-use of disposable personal protective equipment
The staff is aware of use of gloves, when to use (occasion) and its type
Correct Method of wearing mask and cap
Chemical Sterilization of instruments done as per protocol
Adherence to Protocols for autoclaving
Sterility of autoclaved pack maintained during storage
Use of Signal Locks for sterilization
Adherence to Protocol for High Level disinfection
Adequate Contact Time for decontamination
Decontamination of instruments after use
Decontamination of operating and Surface examination table, dressing tables etc. after every procedures
Cleaning of instruments done after decontamination
Staff knows how to make Chlorine solution
Maintenance of air exchanges in OT and ICU
Maintenance of Layout in OT
Carbolization of OT and Labour Room
Maintenance of positive air pressure in OT and ICU
General and patient traffic are segregated in Hospitals
Availability of Alcohol Based hand rub
Display of Hand washing Instructions
Adherence to 6 steps of Hand washing
Staff is aware of when to hand wash
Availability of Sink and running water at point of use
Staff is aware of how manage small spills
Availability of spill management Kit
Staff has been trained for spill management
Spill management protocols are displayed at points if use
Staff is aware of management of large spills
Use of aprons/ Lab coat by the clinical staff
Use of Masks and Head cap
Use of Heavy Duty Gloves and gumboot by waste handlers
Adequate supply of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Use of Gloves during procedures and examination
Security personal reprimands attendants,who found indulging into unhygienic behaviour - spitting, open field urination & defecation, etc.
There is a robust crowd management system.
The main gate of premises, Hospital building, wards, OT and Labour room are secured
Un-authorised vendors are not present inside the campus. Waste storage is secured and there is no plastic items, card board etc.
The security personal are meticulously dressed and smartly turned-out.
Hospital kitchen is located in a separate building, away from patient care area and functions meticulously
Staff observes meticulous personal hygiene
The Kitchen is smoke-free and fly-proofed
Food to patients is distributed through covered trolleys and patients utensils are not dented or chipped - off
The Kitchen has provision to store dry ration and fresh ration separately.
Soiled linen is removed, segregated and disinfected, as per procedure
Patients’ dress are clean and not torn
The facility has adequate stock (including reserve) of linen
Bed-sheets and pillow cover are stain free and clean
Bed-sheets and linen are changed daily
Services provided by the out-sourced organisation are measured periodically and performance evaluation is formally recorded.
There is valid contract for out-sourced services, like house-keeping, BMW management, security, etc.
The Contract has well defined measurable deliverables
The contract has penalty clause and it has been evoked in the event of non- performance or sub-standard performance
There is defined time-line for release of payment to the contractors for the services delivered by the organisation.
Drinking Water is chlorinated
Quality of Water is tested periodically
Water is available at all points of use
The facility receives adequate quantity of water as per requirement
There is storage tank for the water and tank is cleaned periodically
IEC regarding use of toilets is displayed within hospital premises
IEC regarding Swachhata Abhiyan is displayed within the facilities’ premises
Hospital disseminates hygiene messages through other innovative manners
IEC regarding water sanitation is displayed in the hospital premises
IEC regarding importance of maintaining hand hygiene is displayed in hospital premises
Support and Housekeeping staff adhere to their designated dress code
Hospital has dress code policy for all cadre of staff
Nursing staff adhere to designated dress code
Identity cards and name plates have been provided to all staff
There is a regular monitoring of hygiene practices of food handlers and housekeeping staff
Patients are counselled on benefits of Hygiene
Patients are made aware of their responsibility of keeping the health facility clean
Local NGO/ Civil Society Organizations are involved in cleanliness of the hospital
Members of RKS and Local Governance bodies monitor the cleanliness of the hospital at pre-defined intervals
The Health facility has a system to take feed-back from patients and visitors for maintaining the cleanliness of the facility
Hospital has documented Standard Operating procedures for Cleanliness and Upkeep of Facility
Hospital has documented Standard Operating procedures for Bio-Medical waste management and Infection Control
Bio medical waste Management training has been provided to the staff
Infection control Training has been provided to the staff
Hospital conducts are training need assessment regarding cleanliness and infection control in hospital
Roles and responsibility of different staff members have been assigned and communicated
Hospital leadership review the progress of the cleanliness drive on weekly basis
Cleanliness and Infection control committee is constituted at the facility
Hospitals leadership identifies good performing staff members and departments
Cleanliness and infection control committee has representation of all cadre of staff including Group ‘D’ and cleanings staff
